text.0: i with my lips have fashioned for this hero words never matched most plentiful and auspicious.
text.1: for him the ancient great strong energetic the very mighty wielder of the thunder.
text.2: amid the sages with the sun he brightened the parents glorified he burst the mountain.
text.3: and roaring with the holythoughted singers he loosed the bond that held the beams of morning.
text.4: famed for great deeds with priests who kneel and laud him he still hath conquered in the frays for cattle.
text.5: and broken down the forts the fortdestroyer a friend with friends a sage among the sages.
text.6: come with thy girthed mares with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises.
text.7: come hither borne by mares with many heroes lover of song steer for the peoples welfare.
text.8: indra with rush and might sped by his coursers hath swiftly won the waters from the southward.
text.9: thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal incessant and exhaustless.
